title: Lionel Messi's four-match international ban could be against the laws of football, says former ref Graham Poll
text:

Former Premier League referee Graham Poll believes Lionel Messi's four-match international ban may be against the laws of football. 
Barcelona superstar Messi was hit with the sanction by CONMEBOL and FIFA for a foul-mouthed rant at assistant referee Dewson Silva during Argentina's win over Chile last week. 
He missed Tuesday evening's defeat to Bolivia and will be sidelined for three further matches for his country. 
Barcelona released a statement on Wednesday morning slamming the punishment as 'unfair and totally disproportionate', and Poll believes it may even contravene the rules of the game. Barca have slammed the ban as 'unfair and totally disproportionate' (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Messi in action against Chile (Photo: REUTERS) 
In his column in the Daily Mail, Poll wrote: "A FIFA disciplinary committee has watched video evidence and decided to impose the ban, which I believe is against the laws of the game. 
"The incident occurred in full view of the assistant who was abused and therefore the decision of the active match officials should stand. 
"If a player strikes an opponent out of view of all active officials, then a retrospective ban should be imposed. This sanction seems at odds with that."
